metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17546 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
tif_getimage.c in LibTIFF through 4.0.10, as used in GDAL through 3.0.1 andother products, has an integer overflow that potentially causes aheap-based buffer overflow via a crafted RGBA image, related to a"Negative-size-param" condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gdal-bin - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal-java - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal-perl - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal1h - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
python-gdal - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
python3-gdal - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm6').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
